Easy hike with beautiful views. Take this hike on Dragon's Back for some of the most spectacular views, then eat at one of the outdoor restaurants in Shek O.
Unexpected remoteness in Hong Kong. Great half days walk readily accessible by public transport, with some great restaurants in Shek O to conclude your day out.

Great views, easy to get to. Tour company owner Rory Mackay took me by myself on a great afternoon hike along the ridges of the mountains at the eastern side of Hong Kong. Friendly, engaging and knowledgeable. The ridges go up and down, like a dragon's back and there are many lookouts offering great seascape views. Finished at a cafe on Big Wave Beach. A welcome respite from the concrete and glass canyons of Hong Kong and Kowloon. Easy to get to starting spot on the MTR subway system. Be sure to wear hiking boots/sturdy trail shoes and it can be slippery when wet. Bring swimming gear in warmer months and it is possible to rent surf and boogie boards right at the beach.

friendly trails and beautiful views. Hiking may not be the top things to do in hk, but it is good if you have extra time to come here and hike. The trail is friendly (perhaps because I only went to one of the trails... didn't explore further into the mountain) and the views are quite beautiful. It took us around 20 mins (more or less, the views was pretty nice and I sort of lost track of time) from Shau Kei Wan MTR station to Shek O road by bus 9.

best hike in HK for visitors. Hk is not exactly renowned for its hiking but this has to be one of the most beautiful likes i have been on. walking along the rider of the mountain with amazing views on both sides...literally awesome!
Greatr view and not too demanding. We took the bus up to the start and walked on to Shek O for the fish restaurants, well worth the time for the excersice and the views

A beautiful hike with stunning lookouts!. This afternoon hike never fails to disappoint. Accessed via a few different locations, once you're on Dragon's Back it will amuse you with its up and downs for a couple of hours. Finishing the hike at the Thai restaurant in Shek O makes the day even more enjoyable!!

Nice walk, nice views and a good workout.. Get your taxi driver to drop you off on the Shek O road just where the trail to the To Tei Wan Village starts (there is a sign). The hike is only 8.5 km to Big Wave Bay (nice beach) but it will take you a good 2 hours or so as it is up and down and can get busy (narrow but safe). It can get very hot up there so climate cool gear is ideal. It's a lot of steps and some uneven terrain so a reasonable level of fitness is required. Bear in mind once you get to Big Wave Bay and if you want to go onto Shek O you will need to be cashed up. Restaurants on the front are pricey and there are no ATMs and it's pretty much cash only here. You might want to put some swimming gear in your back-pack.

Hiking for all level. The view is definitely worth the walk. Beware to bring food and drink as there is no shop or snack bar along the way! Only two toilet at the beginning and end point. There is no where you can hide if in the case of needing to go . My youngest one only 8. She had fun and managed to walk all the way herself.

Best view of Hong Kong. It was a relatively easy hike. I highly recommend this for beginners. It took us two hours to get up and go down. Prepare to be amazed at the wonderful view of Hong Kong island, and Shek-O beach below. There are just no words to describe the view.No need for a tour guide. There are trail markers all over. Plus, there are a lot of hikers as well, so you won't get lost. Highly recommend taking bus no. 9 to Shek-O (last stop), to have a quick drink by the beach after the long hike.

Hiking in Hong Kong. Hong Kong is not not just about skyscrapers. It has the best hiking trails in Asia where from the top of the hills, you can get magnificent views of the South China Sea or skyscrapers in the background. This trail is a hot spot for tourists. A must do if you are visiting Hong Kong. Not too difficult and the views are gorgeous - you can Google for pictures.
Steep climb through the cemetery. Great little walk trough the forest. Ended up at big wave bay. Nice ancient cliff carvings on the left side looking out over the bay

Great Views, not too* hard. This is a definitely do-able hike, but it's by no means easy all the way through. The footing can get quite uneven, so good shoes are recommended. If you're going to do it, I'd put aside 4-5 hours so you can really enjoy the views, and then get a few beers at Big Wave Bay!

Maybe the best hiking route in the HK island. Reserve few hours and good shoe's to enjoy nice trails and beautiful views to South China sea. On warm days it's smart to reserve enough drinks and small snacks with you.
Definitely recommended!

Fantastic views. Well worth the climbTook us about just over 2hours including stopping for photos to get there you can take bus 9 from Shau Kei Wan Mtr bus terminus to To Tei Wan. Be careful not to miss the stop. The journey takes around 30 mins and bus 9 comes very frequently. The trail starts from the To Tei Wan bus stop, there is a big trail map next to it

Highlight of hongkong. After 9 hours on a plane this was the perfect first activity and it set very high expectations for the rest of the trip. Make sure the weather is good as it will still be very windy up there. Take a backpack with food and do it all yourself. The public transport is so easy in HongKong that getting there only cost about US$5 and took about 20 minutes from the main areas of HongKong island and the walk is free. Go at your own pace And enjoy the view. It is constantly changing which keeps it interesting. No need to book a walking tour as you'll lock yourself in to a schedule and this place is better off without it.

Very scenic and make your way to Big Wave Bay after that to complete the experience.. An easy trek up to the top. Bring a snack along just to have a break and enjoy the sight from up above. Paragliding activities pepper the sky and makes for an excellent photo opportunity. Since you are already there at Dragon's back trek, complete the experience by walking down to the Big Wave Bay to have a mug of beer or fries. Can be a romantic experience..

Brilliant View. If you get a clear day in Hong Kong definitely go up here. (or conversely if you want to work off a hangover) It's a perfect little Hike thats not too intense (although don't wear sandals) and the view is breathtaking.

Awesome views!. It is a short hike up, views were great and is extremely accessible. Directions were clear. It got really windy at the top so make sure you're wearing something windproof. The time to destination on the road signs however were not very reliable.

fantastic views!. wonderful hike! the trail is well marked and easy to hike. the views are wonderful. it's hard to believe that one is in Hong Kong, easy to access. we took bus 9 to To Tei Wan, hiked to Big Wave Beach, walked to Shek O and took bus 9 back. Took us most of the day -- it was wonderful!

Great views moderate hike. The weather was a bit cloudy but we still had some good views. The hike itself is a moderate level - some steep sections but well within capabilities of anyone with reasonable fitness levels. very enjoyable and takes about 2 hours.

Easy and easily accessible hike on HK island with great views. This is a great chilled hike on the island, easily accessible with public transport (bus drops you off by the trail start) offering great views throughout. The surface is proper terrain rather than paved path / stairs and given its accessibility, difficulty level (easy / moderate) and popularity, it is a great hike to do alone or with a group without much preparation. Do bring water though. There is a cheap shuttle back and food / drink options at the beach where you can end-up.

Easy and beautiful hike you can do alone. I was told by friends to either choose the Dragon's Back or Sai Kung route, with the former being relatively easy and more manageable for a solo hike. The route up was really easy, and the views up Dragon's Back absolutely beautiful on a sunny day! You'll get a bird's eye view of the coastal areas bordering the South China Sea and Shek O beach; the sea looks endless as the different hues of blues of the sky and the sea gently touch. To get there, take bus 9 from Shau Kei Wan MTR station for a scenic 25 min journey up to Shek O road (sit on the upper deck!). Stop at To Tei Wan and you'll see the start of the trek nearby. I took a couple of stops to soak in the view, and took about 2.5 hours to complete my hike. The latter half (about 1 hour),where you descend from dragon's back, is less scenic in the forrested areas. Take the time to think hard about whether you should have Yat Lok roasted goose and char Siew or dim sum (or both) for dinner :p Tough decisions! At the end of the trial you could choose to go down to Big Wave Beach, but that will take another one hour down to the beach and another up to Siu Sau Wan, where you can catch a bus back to the nearest MTR.Definitely go on a sunny day where the views are best! Avoid going on a wet day as it might make the return route a little slippery and dangerous. Enjoy!! I didn't try Sai Kung but I heard the views are even better. If you have the time, do both :-).

Good hike with great views. The Dragon's Back trail is a moderate up-and-down hike with excellent views of the ocean and the village of Shek-O. Nice change of pace if you feel like you've been in metro Hong Kong too long and want to see some natural beauty.
Nice island hike. This is one of the better hikes on Hong Kong island and it brings you to some really interesting spots. Bring enough water !

The perfect coastal hike. This hike is awesome, firstly because it's super easy to get to via local bus, which drops you right at the trail head. The hike itself is not too challenging but offers really nice views of the water the whole time, and it is real terrain rather than stairs. It takes about 2-3 hours to arrive at the beach, which was a surprise for me! The restaurant we arrived to after the hike was just what we needed, and there was a cheap shuttle all the way back to the subway station: another great surprise!

Nice walk with some great coastal views. I'm a keen walker so if i get the opportunity to go walking when i'm on holiday i like to take it. Its a nice change from being in the busy city . I picked up a 'Hiking in Hong Kong' leaflet from the tourist information in the city and this looked the most accessible . Plenty of previous reviewers here have mentioned how to get to the start as the MTR and the bus is an easy and cheap way . There are a few ups and downs on this walk but it shouldn't be too difficult for most reasonably fit people . The path is well signposted and theres some great views along the top part . Some of it is under tree cover which would provide some handy shade on warmer days . You would certainly need plenty of water with you if walking in the hotter times of the year as there is nothing until you reach the small surf village at the end . We really enjoyed this walk which took us around 3 hrs .

Great escape!. I caught the metro from central to a MTR station that I forget the name of and then a bus from that MTR station to the beginning of this hike. It can be quite windy but also hot from the amount of walking so pack layers of clothing that you can put on or take off. The walk all the way to big wave bay is definitely worth it. There is no need to then have to walk back the way you came as at big wave bay there is a bus that can take you back to the MTR station.

Easily accessible walk with great views. This walk takes about 3 hrs from where the no. 9 bus drops you on Shek O road to just past big wave beach on the way to Shek O where you catch the same bus further along the road. After a steep climb for about 45 min you walk up and down the dragons back with great views to the coast and the urban environment. When you descend the mountain you walk along a wooded trail then down to the excellent big wave beach. It was winter so cold and windy but it would be lovely in summer. A great walk. Take food with you, though you can get food at the beach.
4-hr trek, but the views are amazing!. Go ahead, trek to Dragon's Back! You won't regret it the views are amazing and there's plenty of photo stops too!

An easy-going 10K hike ending on the beach. Going for a hike isn't the first thing at the top of my list when looking for things to do on holiday, however when our friend who lives in Hong Kong suggested we go on this hike I wasn't really sure how it would be...I'm a keen gym goer, but at the time of year we went it was just after Christmas so needless to say I hadn't been to the gym for a while or eaten that well in the weeks leading up! Despite this, the hike was surprisingly easy going and really good fun.Depending on what route you take, you can end up on the beach (which is the option we took) and it was really beautiful and a great end to the trek.

good to see another side of HK. We walked the dragons back in the mild weather of December with some friends - apparently it's not one of the more challenging hikes on the island.The 10k-ish walk we did was pretty easy for a group of mid-twenties / early 30 year olds. I'm not sure i'd like to do it in the sweltering heat of the summer tho!great to see a more natural side of HK and great to end on Shek-O beach and have some food down there, would recommend

Nice view, very windy at the top. It's been more than 3 years since my last trek in Bali. Dragon's Back is relatively easy to trek. Took me about 3 hours as I started from a bus stop before. Weather that day was good and the wind at the top was really strong. Very shiok. You can oversea Stanley since Stanley is further down from Sheik O where Dragon's Back is located. It's one good place to go if you are tired of the city and you want some exercise in fresh air. After the descent, take bus service no. 9 back to Shau Kei Wan bus terminal. There's nice and cheap wanton noodle shop to go. You can then stroll the market there and you can find some cheap fruits as well as old time kueh kueh sold by an old auntie that you may not find them in Singapore (maybe can still find them in Malaysia)

Easy and Beautiful Trail. We started from the shek o road which we reached from a minibus near MTR exit A and the starting path was the only hardest part to climb. The trial offered beautiful views and wasn't crowded as it was a weekday.It was unfortunate that a lad from a group of young hikers who were a bit ahead of us met an accident.Nonetheless,the trial was beautiful and we ended up in a beautiful beach.

So near and yet so far. A short drive from the Hong Kong hustle and bustle lies the Dragons Back reserve. I went for a hike there on a public holiday and the initial stage was packed with people. However the general public only seemed to walk the first bit and soon I was alone, far from the madding crowd. It was a beautiful walk, excellently maintained and sign posted and a perfect antidote to the city. I used a taxi to get there and back.

Different side of the Island. I really loved this walk. I wasn't expecting such natural beauty to abound in Hong Kong. The walk was easy and just long enough. It gave me a different perspective on what it must be like to live in Hong Kong. We started with the beautiful views, then spent the last half or more walking through forest areas. We ended at a beautiful beach - wih a great simple beach restaurant.

My Hong Kong Ritual. Every time Im in Hong Kong I hit the Dragons Back, rain or shine. Im older now and cat do the sneaky back trails up, but the normal trail is still breathtaking (literally!). You can cab it, but for the full effect I start by Causeway Bay Line to Shau Kei Wan and then cath the No 9 Bus upstairs. You will go up and up into the hills. Bus makes a sharp right turn, Then more up. Next intersection if makes a sharp left. Ring the bell for the next stop. Get off and begin up the stairs. End at anoint bus stop where you will take the bus again to Shek O and have lunch at the Shek O Thai Chinese restaurant and be sure to have a lime soda before you hit the beers !!

Magnificent view of seaside but only for those love hiking. The trail has magnificent view of the seaside of Shek O, it takes about 2-3 hours to finish, thus only suitable for those love hiking and have plenty of time to spend in Hong Kong. You can just take less than half an hour to travel from the most busy part of Hong Kong business center to enjoy the lovely nature with breath taking view of Shek O from this trail. There are a lot of restaurants in Shek O village that you can enjoy your food after hiking.

Always a delight!. A must do hike in HK. Very scenic.If you are moderately fit, are in HK on a sunny day, do climb up this, and I would say have a few extra hours on hand so you can spend at the top of hill just admiring the views from different points and taking some breathlessly beautiful pictures!Also after you end the hike at the Big Wave Bay beach, can see one of the best beaches in HK. A little cafe there can provide with coffee, drinks, pizzas etc. Can plan to go to Shek O beach too, which is a short cab ride from Big Wave Bay. So a good family outing overall. Even a 5 to 6 year old kid who doesn't mind walking and climbing, can do this hike.Make it a family day out in HK!

Great views + a mysterious grave with a view. . The trail was not too challenging and the view was amazing. We even discovered this grave overlooking the best view in HK. Does anyone know the history behind this "King of the Hill"?

A Trail Worth The View!. As a traveler who has been to Hong Kong numerous times, I was pleasantly surprised to find the beautiful nature and landscape of the area only a short trip from bustling center. A ride on the MTR (to Shau Kei Wan Station) and a 25 min or so bus ride (#9 bus to Shek-O) up to the trail head, you find yourself hiking a wonderful trail (easy/moderate level) overlooking several beaches and fantastic panoramic views. A must do for visitors looking for a nature retreat!

Loved doing this!!. If you have enough time, you should definitely do this. I went on this hike w/ a friend, on May 2015. Sunny, hot, beautiful day. We did only the first half of the hike... I am not a sporty kind of girl and managed to do it easily. We came across 4/5 other groups of hikers maximum, it is a refreshing getaway from the crowds.Doing this hike, I had a revealing moment that made me realized what I love about HK. Whatever you're looking for, you will find it. You have the hip restaurants and bars, the markets, the temples, the shopping, the skyline, the museums, the art, the beaches, the nature. What does it lack? I am yet to find out.Highly recommend it. (Don't forget the water, the mosquito repelent, sunglasses and a hat if you'd like)

Couldn't recommend this trek enough . Wow wow wow wow, is the only way to describe. We took a taxi from time square to the beginning of dragons back trek it came to around $180 Hong Kong dollars which is nothing in pounds for a 30 minute taxi ride, through seaside towns and small villages. Once on the trek the view were simply outstanding. We went on a clear sunny day which I'm sure helped loads. Comfy trainers is a must, sun cream, insect repellent, plenty of water and snacks! No shops anywhere once you start. We ended our trek at big wave beach. It was a welcome sight to be able to get your trainers off and enjoy the seawater. So bring some swimwear

Such fun!. With Hong Kong's great transportation, it wasn't hard to get out to To Tei Wan to start the beautiful hike. We hiked the whole Dragon's Back trail into Big Wave Bay, and we were blown away literally and figuratively by the wind and the views. It isn't too hard of a hike, but it's fairly long. Going with friends and taking in the amazing sights are totally worth every second of it. It was really such fun, and some time on the beach and a great little meal in Bug Wave Bay topped it all off amazingly.

Scenic work out! . Great 2 1/2 walk on Hong Kong island with stunning views! A decent work out but not too tough. No water or toilets on the way so make sure you're quite well planned ahead of time. You can do this in runners but might be safer when you're heading down to wear something with a bit of ankle protection. Head in to Shek o afterwards for a delicious Thai meal at Happy Garden

Beautiful n easy hike.. A getaway from the crowds . This is a fairly easy hike but one that do gets you away from the crowds n sprawling city to the greens n blues of the forest n the coastline.. Transfer is very convenient - by MTR to Shau Kei Wan n bus 9 from the bus terminal outside the station. Prerecorded announcement of the next stops can be heard n location flashed on a screen near the front of the bus so it is very easy to know where to get down the bus (at To Tei Wan).. Only the first part of the hike involves a climb to the views of the bay n from that onwards, a easy undulating hike.. The walk is very well signposted.. So no worries about getting lost.. I was fairly late, getting there about 230 to 3 pm on a weekday afternoon there were fair no of people doing the hike. Not too crowded so it felt like getting away from the crowd.

great hike, great views. This is a great way to spend a day or half day away from the crowds of HK Central or Mong Kok. We went to hike Dragon's Back on New Year's Eve. The weather was clear and sunny, but there weren't too may hikers around. The hike offers great views of the sea , of Shek O and Tai Tam. Not too difficult a hike and suitable for younger children too - our 7-year old daughter very much enjoyed the hike. After the hike you can go Big Wave beach and enjoy a drink while watching the surfers.....

A great way to spend half of a day. We did half of the walk. We took M16 minibus just outside Chai Wan Station (last MTR stop Island line) to Tai Tam Training Centre at 2pm(5-10 mins ride). We climbed a short staircase and reached the mid-point of the No. 8 trail. We turned to the right which led to the uphill path to Shek'o. The left side will go to Big Wave Bay downhill. The uphill path needed a bit of tackle and so should wear a pair of good walking shoes.The weather was perfect. It was windy at the top but was warm with Sun at the back. After 2 1/2 hr walk at leisure pace, we reached the exit where there was a bus stop. The no. 9 bus took us to the Shek-O beach. The beach is the best in HK. Had afternoon tea at one of the local stores. Perfect way to spend half a day under the December sun.

Amazing hike . We did the dragons back hike and absolutely loved it! The views of the ocean was spectacular and it fler really exotic to be just one hour from the city and in absolute serenity. The hike wasnt difficult and the signs were easy to find. We finished our hike with pizza on big wave beach and a wonderful swim in the refreshing sea. If you are in Hong Kong for only a few days i strongly recommend this hike!!

Spectacular and comfortable hike !. This is a comfortable hike. We did a portion of it ( about 5 miles). Weather was excellent although very windy on the top. Clean trail and was not crowded - we started early to avoid crowds, but found crowds as we were on our way out!

Great day spent away from the crowds. We loved this hike - it had so many beautiful views. It was hard enough that we felt like we'd gotten a good hike in, but easy enough to be fun. Was fun seeing all the hangliders. The tricky part for us was at the end - we weren't quite sure where exactly it did end. We thought it would take us to Big Wave Beach but we somehow ended up at a bus stop and going to Shek-O Beach - which was just fine.

Blissful Escape from HK City . My boyfriend and I were lucky to have clear skies the day we tackled this hike so visibility was great! We were surprised near the end of the trek to discover Big Wave Beach which has white sand and is a paradise for surfers. They also have a sandwich/burger cafe on the beach with local made IPA beer for a great price! We did the hike in 5 hours and this included a 20-minute stop along the way, lots of stops for pictures, and 30-minutes on the beautiful beach. We went on a Thursday and it wasn't too crowded at all!

easy hike with nice views. Take a mini-bus for Shek O at Shau Kei Wan MTR station Exit A and tell the driver you'll get off at Dragon's Back. There you'll be at the entrance of the trail. It's an easy hike and the views are rewarding. On a sunny day, it's especailly beautiful. It takes around 3 hours, depending on your speed of walk.

Nice Easy Trek. It was raining slightly when we were there. But its still ok to trek.
WE went on Christmas Day and amazingly its still quite a crowd. Its fairly easy to trek. Only the front portion with the up hill climb was tiring . The rest are quite ok

Very nice hiking . Spectacular view especially in a crowded city like Hong Kong.
Min 3 hours for the whole hike.
The tofu desert at the bottom is delicious and nice beach as a reward after the hike.

Amazing walk well worth it. Loved this walk, I would describe it as easy to moderate in level. You need to wear shoes not sandals however converse or trainers are fine, you don't need walking boots. Take water and a cereal bar etc with you as there are no shops on the route. To get there take MTR blue line towards Chai Wan, get off at Shau Kei Wan station two before the end of the line. Go to the bus station outside its right there and very clear and get on the bus number 9. It's $6.50hk per adult. Ask the driver to point out the start of the dragons back walk, it's about a 20 minute ride till you get there. It's a 5km walk along the top of a ridge with beautiful views east and west looking over Stanley and other islands just beautiful. After 5km you can come off to the left and meet the shek o road and catch the number 9 back. Or if you still have energy and want to continue your walk down to the beach and catch the bus from there after a dip in the ocean! A great day out and really easy to do. Cheap too...enjoy!

Great Hike, Fantastic Views. It's amazing you can escape the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong and get into nature so fast. This is a lovely trail with amazing views. A little crowded with other hikers, but would definitely recommend.

Soon up there brilliant. I followed others TAs advice and got the No 9 bus from Sha Kai Wan Station and got off at the good starting point they drop you off at . The other TAs have some great advice so I will add something different. It took me about 3,5 hours as I was taking too many pics and listen ending to birds ! I reached the peak and thought I was at least half way on my way to Big Waves Beach. I wasn't ! I would estimate you are only a quarter or a third max way there. After all the views in the first half I missed them in the second through the forest but enjoyed it all. The beach is great but one TIP when u r waiting for the bus and the light bus comes with Shek O on his bus, check he REALLY is going mine took me directly back to Sha Kai Wan bus station and wafted me to the MTR bus ! I decided to give it a miss and went to Stanley..... Bad choice Shek O looked so much nicer.

Take a morning off from the city to enjoy this great hike!. Took the metro to Shau Kei Wan station and transfer to Bus No. 9 heading towards Shrek O at the bus interchange.There were signages to follow so it was a straightforward trail.We completed the trail within 1.5 - 2h, with plenty of stops along the way to take photos. Breathtaking views awaited us when we did the trail on a hot, sunny day in June. Trail was quiet that day, only met 1-2 groups of hikers that morning.Should be more comfortable and less scorching if the trail is completed in the more cooling months of the year, other than during summer.Worth setting aside one morning to have a short get away from the bustling city. If you are there for the views, recommended to go on a sunny & cloudless day. Bring at least a bottle of water for hydration!

Awesome hikking day. If you are lucky enough like me, you will find yourself on the dragon's back with a blue sky and really hot weather. All will be there to enjoy it.At the end don't forget to to toward the beach, to rest after a good walk.

Great Walk - not too hard :). We headed up on a warm and busy day - saying that - people are generally happy to move to the side. This isn't the case in normal Hong Kong, so it must've been a really nice day. Great views - make sure you don't go on a foggy day. We got a taxi there - super easy and then caught the bus back. I can't even tell you which one but really easy to wander down to the road and get a bus back to the train station. We did Dragon's back, which is the basic height. Then you can add a walk down to the beach and back. Happy hiking :)

Beautiful nature trail - best to do during the week. A beautiful hike that takes you to wonderful look outs! The hike only took me 2,5 h not walking super quick. At the end a nice small beach awaits you where some surfers search for waves. If you continue the walk on the left of the beach up the coastline you can walk back to the metro by foot. I would recommend to do the hike during the week to avoid crowds.
Great hike, not strenuous. Relatively easier hike.. can finish in 1.5-2 hours. The views on the way are amazing - take a pause to enjoy the same.

Gorgeous views, nice hike. Easy hike to get to with amazing views. Wild rose bushes line the trail making it even more picturesque.
Nicely maintained trail with some steep parts to get the lungs pumping and buns burning.

Great walk with views and different to built up Hong Kong. This is a beautiful walk - not too challenging although it does have steep stretches. You can access it by the MTR then a bus and can pick up another bus at the other end to take you back. The walk takes around 2 hours. Be careful in the rain as some of the steep sections are mud over rock - could be slippery.
Nice trail. Nice trail for family on a sunny day.2 hours walk is needed if you don't want to run.Nice restaurants in Shek O when the walk is done ;)
stunning views !. Not too difficult hike, with beautiful views to Shek O and surroundings. Can be windy upstairs, bit slippery when it rains. Busy in the weekends, but really still lovely.

A different side of Hong kong. The walk along the Dragons Back is amazing. Breathtaking views and not a shop insight! The walk is not too strenuous but sturdy shoes are a must. The views are a photographer's dream

Wonderful hike for a beginner ^6^. For hikers, u might not want to miss this place..One of my highlight day trip in Hong Kong. Easily accessible via bus ride to Shek O road, the starting of the trail and will end at Big Wave Bay. It took about 3-4hours journey (depends on individual's pace). Don't forget to bring extra clothes in case u wanna get urself wet at bigwave bay. If u're a surfer, even better as u can do one there. Surfing boat rental and other necessities are available at bigwave bay small village. Tips: The journey is kinda long, make sure u're well prepared with hydration source and probably some energy bars? There is no food available along the trails until u reach the end at the bigwave bay where u can grab the local food. *The BBQ chic was good ;) give it a try! Most part of the trails are exposed to sunlight, so be well prepared :) ..but during the period I was there, the weather on top was kinda chilly and cooling...I love it so much. Last but not least, have fun!!! :)

Lovely hike to amazing beach. We got lucky because when we started the hike the sun was shining and the sky was clear. Temperature 18c. It's one of the light hiking trails on HKI but still comes with stunning views. The peak itself is 284m. You'll arrive at a nice beach where You can swim and surf is weather allows. Locals are very friendly and helpful.

A Truly Lovely Day Hike!. I had a very brief trip to Hong Kong and really wanted to focus on nature more than anything too "cityish" in the little time I had. This hike was absolutely perfect for my purposes. It was super easy to get to via public transportation (take MTR to Shao Kei Wan, then bus no. 9 to Cape Collision stop). Once there, the hike was pretty easy but totally gorgeous, starting off more enclosed by trees and eventually leading you to wide open spaces with amazing views of the the ocean and little towns. The trail was pretty well traveled and we met friendly people along the way. It was particularly sweet to watch a group of older men who met at the top of the peak to fly their model airplanes in the wind. The hike took maybe a little more than 2 hours with plenty of stops for photos and just to enjoy the view. We took the trail down to Shek O road and then caught the bus to take us down to Shek O beach. (PS...upon reaching the road do NOT take the super steep staircase that says Tei Wan. We did so because we weren't sure what was down there and my calves still haven't forgiven me for the journey back up.) Shek O beach is really nice as well. The town is cute and has shops and restaurants where you can fill up after working up an appetite. Would definitely go back again!
Excellent!!!!!!!. You will love it once you've been there! You can see the whole view of big wave bay. For whole period I walked around 3 hour including rest and take photos.

beyond words. perfect for a daytrip with a nice bath at the end! The bus ride to the starting point of the hike was a little bit adventurous as the names of the bus stops are a little bit confusing but once the trail is found a new world opens up! the view on top of the mountain range is incredible, the middle and last part are very diverse and lead through woods, scenic streets and offers a diversified view on the city! the end of the hike, the big wave beach, is one of the most amazing beaches I have ever seen!

Great place to visit. One of the most beautiful landscapes available in Hong Kong, specially if you are used to big cities and want to go hiking, not a difficult trail since I'm asthmatic and had no problems at all.

The easy pathway to get to the top of Dragon's back hike. First stop at the MTR station shau kei wan and takes the bus no.9 to To Tei Wan after a little walk you will see the beautiful view all along the way it take for 2.30-3.00 hour to get downside and there will be the guidepost to where you want to go next likes Shek o spended 25 mins, Big wave spended 1 hour i plan to go to big wave beach if would be great if the exhausted day end with the beach view but my friend kinda exhausted and we have a lot of things to do so we decided to Shek O to get the bus took us back to town. Thumb Up for the view would be there again for sure!! Note : the weather in december was cold like 16 C prepare for your body

Beautifulfull scenery won't disappoint you!. Easily access by MRT and Bus to Shek O.. The hiking course is suitable for all age and family. It is only around 280m to the top but the views is stunning! You only need to pay cheap transport and enjoy the sceneries without any fees. The air is frsh and good for health. Do not miss!

Small hike with nice views for everybody. Dragon's Back trail is a small hike from the bus stop to the peak of the hill. Easily accessible by public transportation.The hike from the bus stop to the peak takes some 45 minutes. The path is clearly marked and easy to follow. Part of the trail is with stone steps, partially nature provided. Wear at least running shoes for safe hiking.Vies are beautiful on the way and especially on the top of the hill.The hike can be extended for a longer one by continuing it further from the peak.There is a paragliding take off area close to the peak so if winds are moderate (15-25 km/h) additional bonus can be that you see pilots soaring above the top of the hill.Take subway blue line (Island line ) to Chai Wan direction and get off at Shau Kei Wan station (the third station before the final stop). Then go to bus terminus adjacent to the subway station and transit to bus nr 9. The bus takes some 20 min to the start of the trail. Bus driver knows where you need to take off.

Dragon's Back near Shek O Hong Kong. Easy to get to by metro to Shau Kei Wan station, exit to the bus terminal outside and get on the #9 bus for Skek O. Can't remembered how much it costed for fare, but tell the driver your stop is 'To Tei Wan - 土地灣' which is the start of the trail. The 'next bus stop' is usually displayed inside the bus in English and Chinese. There are portable toilets at start and end of the trail. Steep climb at the start, may be a little difficult for some, then it's quite pleasant hike. There are shades from the trees but be prepare for the sun and remember to take water. It was a sunny Nov day we went and there was light breeze at the top with beautiful view of Shek O and Stanley. We took the turning to the left when we came to the junction where the portable toilets were, to get the bus back to Shau Kei Wan. To take the turning on the right would be a hike down to Shek O and the seaside.

To Tei Wan - Dragon's Back - Big Wave Bay Trail. Great view! Trails are good. Took me 3hrs to get to Big Wave Bay. Go earlier than 2pm for a more relaxing hike, started to get dark around 5. Alight at Shau Kei Wan MTR Station, exit at A3, go around the wet market in front of the bus terminus for a bit, take the Bus 9 route, alight at To Tei Wan Stop. Trail starts here, wear light clothes, bring water & snacks, 1hr to reach Dragon's back then you will have the option to continue to the Big Wave Bay Trail (1hr) or Tai Tam Gap (0.25hr). Before continuing the Big Wave Trail, there's also a trail to the cemetery on the left of the picnic area. The trail ends at the Big Wave Bay Village. You'll see a lot of surfing shops, restaurants. There's a minibus that goes back to the MTR for HKD10.
Beautiful!. Beautiful view and wonderful hike! After hiking you can even enjoy a nice picnic with friends or head down to one of the beaches :)
Good Half Day Out. Good trail overlooking a few bays along the HK coast. A bit undulating at certain points. Good work out. Ended at Big Waves Beach with a chilled isotonic can at hand. Would return.
Nice run. Went there for a run on a saturday afternoon. It is very easy to access by MTR + bus. Nice spot for running with an incredible view

Amazing trail!. With beautiful coastal scenery and easy accessibility from the city of HK, the Dragon’s Back is a popular tourist destination. A short hop from the bustle of Hong Kong East, the trail provides stunning views of Shek O, Tai Long Wan, Stanley, Tai Tam, and the South China Sea. The entrance to the hike is on Shek O Road near To Tei Wan village.

Overun with people. Being an avid hiker I was looking forward to walking Dragons Back. Maybe I just picked the wrong day, but there were literally hundreds of people doing the same walk.Many were not even spending the time to look at the scenery, reminded me of a theme park and not a hike.
One of the best hiking trails!. Easily accessible from the city centre, Dragon's back is one of the best hikes you can possibly get in a world-class city.

Nice walk/hike close to hong kong. If your in Hong Kong and want a different perspective then this is a good walk/hike. Its not hard and easily accessible by bus or taxi. From memory took an hour or so. The views are really good.
Great hike. Not overly challenging, but with young children the hike quickly becomes 2+ hours as they will struggle in places.

Great Hike for Beginners. Simply head to Shau Kei Wan MTR, take Exit A3 and you will see a bus terminal. Take BUS #9 towards Shek-O, and alight at To Tei Wan stop on Shek O Road. If you're unsure when to alight, simply ask the bus driver to help.. or keep a look out for a bus stop on the slope that many alight. I would have missed the stop, if I did not bump into local hikers which told us that here's the stop for the start of the trail. Don't be afraid to ask :)My trip was back in MARCH 2015, it was humid on the main island. However under the shady pathway and forest trails, it felt really cooling and comfortable. Towards the highest point of the hike, the shades disappear and you get an aerial view of the island. I will highly recommend this trail any time of the year, except September which I feel is Hong Kong's hottest period~ Wear proper footwear, stay hydrated. There are honey bees along the trail, as there are beautiful flowers on the isles - so.. don't smell too sweet ;)

Easy hike with a great view. The whole hike is more of the Hong Kong trail of which Dragon's Back is a part. To get up to Dragon Back takes perhaps 1.5 hours but it continues on all the way to Big Wave Beach and overall i took 3-4 hours. Even on a weekday there are locals and tourists visiting. There are clear signs on directions. When you reach Big Wave beach you can get food and refreshments and chill on the beach. Many people surf there and you can take a mini bus to Shau Kei Wan MTR.

Beautiful Views! Go when its cool, terrain is moderate-to-difficult. This is a wonderful hike if you are looking for a half-day hike (2-3 hours), with beautiful views of the sea and Shek O. We read it was only supposed to be 90 minutes with an hour up and 30 minutes down but the total time ended up being closer to 2-2 1/2hrs total. Just when you think give reached the top, there are more peaks to climb! The terrain is moderat to difficult. Lots of rocks that are quite dry, dusty and slippery. I would not recommend this hike for small children or those wanting to go on a hike with animals. There were quite a few trying to make the trek up with their small dogs and they were over heated and not doing well at all. I strongly advise against it, it is not safe or meant for animals it is much too strenuous.Bring lots of water as there are no drink stations, or restroom stops along the way. Once you get to the top its well worth it but the walk down is quite long and rigerous as well.

Gem in the city. Great trail to go for half a day. It's an hour by bus and metro from Central. Takes 3-4 hrs to finish the hike. A beach is tucked at the end of the trail so make sure you left enough time for it.

Fabulous Contrast to Hong Kong Highrise. Fill your lungs with fresh air, rub shoulders with nature (not people) & drink in some of the most amazing views of HK Island. The Dragon’s Back walking trail is the hike that keeps on giving ... rise after rise (its a 2-3 hour hike depending on your pace & the number of pics you take!) Fabulous contrast to the densely populated & high rise skyline of Hong Kong. After that refuel with some of the tastiest local food down in Shek – O village.

Great experience 👍. It tooks three hours from us to finish it but we enjoyed every second of the adventure. The views was fabulous and the sky was clear .. if l had much time l won't hesitate to hike there again.You should try it of you like adventures and make sure that you will spend a lovely half day there but don't forget to take some snacks and water and your camera will be important to make your memories become immortal.

Easy walk with some incredible views!. Definitely worth a visit for anyone who wants to take a break from the hustle of Hong Kong's busy downtown. Just 15 minutes away from the closest metro station, this walk takes a couple hours max. for anyone with some degree of fitness. Expect hills and stairs!

Straightforward walk with great views.. On weekends expect this walk to be busy. Lots of people doing this simple, well tracked and marked walk. We walked from the correctional facility near Tai Tam Gap. Turned right at the fork where left trail goes to Pottinger Gap. There's a short pull up to the main ridge after 1.5km from where there are some super views of Big Wave Bay and over into HK. Thereafter it's a simple case of flowing the path. The drop right down to the road is the best route off. I tried to flow a scrubby path loosely marked on the map at the southern end of the ridge but it's was impenetrable. The one downside is the schlep to Shek O on the road. We had the dog with us so couldn't take the bus. The road slopes downhill so it's easy walking but seems to go on for ages. Also, most of it is without a pavement and the drivers can be loony. Count on 3-4 hours for the trek from start to finish in Shek O.

stunning sites on a clear day. a challenging hike but stunning views on a clear day. clear days are hard to come by in HK but worth the trip if you find one. spend the afternoon in Shek 0 or Big Wave Bay.
Nice hike. A very nice hike, not difficult. But on weekends very crowded!!Take the trail further all the way to big wave bay beach and enjoy an afternoon surfing and swimming.

Nice Hiking Trail for your 1 day trip. There are signs along the path. You will be sure that you won't be lose the way to destination. Not too difficult trail for beginners. Just try this. I just found this place like this in HK.

Very easy hike with beautiful views from top. This was a very easy hike and a bit crowded on weedends. the view from top was beautiful but after some point there is not view and half way through it is a downhill hike to the beach.But spending time on Big Wave beach at the end is relaxing and peaceful. the beach is average, nothing spectacular. but i like simplicity.it is easily accessible with public transportation using MTR + bus number 9

Rewarding hike. Was really looking forward to this, coming from hiking on the Rocky Mountains in Colorado my wife and I were really excited about hiking near the ocean. The top of the peak is only about 1500m from the trailhead, but it is a bit of a climb. Rewarding views of Tai Tam Harbor, Shek O and Big Wave Bay. We ended up continuing past Shek O peak and hooking up with the last section of the Hong Kong trail for a total hike of around 7-8km, ending at Big Wave Bay. Nice little village, you can get water and something to eat before jumping in to the surf.

Awesome Hike!. Our family of four, with kids ages 9 and 11, hiked from To Tei Wan to Big Wave Beach, 7.5 km in 2.5 hours at an easy pace, 9:30-11:50. Hot, but bearable. Take 1L water per person, snack, sun protection. Awesome island views from Shek-O peak. Awesome to get out of the city into the lush, natural beauty of Hong Kong Island! Go!

Excellent route, clearly laid out with great views. What more can I say, excellent. We took the bus up to the start point and walked over the Dragon's Back down to Big Wave Bay.The views are first class with many photo opportunities. Good pair of walking shoes is all that's required in any dry spell. Walking boots advisable when wet.We met the Ranger Manager whilst walking the route and he was very friendly. When descending down into Big Wave Bay, walk past the first recommended turning and take the long sweep down into the bay as it's far more scenic and rewarding. Check the route map.Make sure you have 10HKD cash each for the bus back down from Big Wave Bay, as they do not take an octopus card. !!!
Excellent hike with wonderful views. If you have time for a hike while in HK, go to Dragon's Back. Wonderful hike with great ocean and some city views. You won't regret it.
Easy beautiful hiking trail in Hong Kong Island. Great hiking trail in Hong Kong Island, takes around 90mins to 2 hours walk, not too much incline so easy going. Easy to get to buy bus.

Great hike!. Great hike to escape from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong city! Convenient to get to (bus 9 Shek O Bus terminus) and the hike would be moderately difficult. A bit of a climb in the beginning, a lot of steps but definitely manageable. View at the peak is great! Strong winds, so it might be a good idea to wrap up during the colder months. Only 1 toilet along the way. A good idea to pack some snacks (if required) and use the restrooms before starting the trek!Took about 2 + hours to complete the trek. At the end of the trek, we chanced upon a minibus who was waiting to ferry passengers for HKD $10 each back to the MTR station (we did not expect this as its stated on the trail's website to walk back to Shek O Road to catch bus 9 back to the bus terminus). We were happy to see the minibus as our feet were pretty weary by that time. Start the trek in the morning when it is cooler.

Great Hike. Did the hike in november, which was actually the best, as it was dry yet cloudy, with temperatures around 25°.Trekkingshoes are not necessary, good sport shoes will do their job. After rainfall some passages could be a little muddy.It's a 5,25km distance and I did it in 1h10 with some short photo stops
Great for visiting friends. An easy hike with great views and the rewards of a beach and a beer at the end. A lot of steps and hills but definitely doable even for beginners.

Stunning Views. I hiked the Dragons Back two days after arriving in HKG in a bid to get rid of the jet lag - plenty of fresh air and exercise. Breathtaking views and definitely worth the hike. Go early morning when it's cool.

Best Hiking trail for tourists. Getting there by a minibus at the exit of Shau Kei Wan MTR station, you will be at the starting point of the trail in around 20minutes. Walking up the stone peddles you will reach a Y section which if you take the right, you will be going up to the Dragon's backbone and be able to look over the shek O beach from the hill. The whole journey only takes an hour of leisure walking, which then lead you back to your starting point in no time. Sneakers/ hiking boots recommended since there are many big and small rocks, the path is mostly not paved.

Great, Easy Hike!. Not normally a very active soul, but this hike is easy enough and the scenery is totally worth it! Sights could give you a bit of a sense of vertigo if you're afraid of heights, but views are beautiful.Try to plan to end the hike at Tai Long Wan or Shek O. Nothing like chilling on the beach after a nice hike.

excellent trail outside HK centre. if you like hiking , this is the one you should do in HK . On the dragons back , a nice view to the sea on both sides of the hill . it can be very hot , take your drinks with you !!!

Excellent walk with wonderful views. Well worth venturing out to do these hill trails. The views are wonderful and we enjoyed several hours of hill walking. Not sure I'd want to attempt these trails if the weather had been wet - might be quite slippery.

Interesting. I went expecting it to be very difficult but it was actually enjoyable. There are some amazing views but at the beginning of the hike and the most difficult part of the hike it the middle part of it that is shaped like a dragons back and the rest is all flat. A beginner can do the hike but it will be a bit tiring. Definitely worth hiking this track

Best hiking trail in HK embracing both urban and rural views. If you think Hong Kong is a just a business centre without beauty of nature, you must have missed Dragon's Back on your place-to-go list.Dragon's back is the ridge of Shek O Peak and location of Section 8 of Hong Kong Trail. The Authority gives the trail a 3-star rating on difficulty -- Nonsense! It is an easy walk even for primary school children. On Dragon's Back you can enjoy the spectacular view of Shek O peninsula and Turtle Cove, as well as the refreshing breeze from the South China Sea. Make sure you take a pic in front of the plaque of Shek O Peak and the lumpy traverse station.As you advance along the trail, you will be out of the rural area for a moment and see the urban view of Chai Wan all of a sudden. Many visitors are amazed by this teleport-like experience.Further to the end of the trail you will be back to the village and beach of Tai Long Wan. It has been a surfers' haunt for many years (even in times of typhoon attacks). Near the beach there is a rock carving created by early inhabitants which now becomes a Declared Monument of Hong Kong.To go to Dragon's back, take NWFB Route. 9 from Shau Kei Wan MTR Station to To Tei Wan stop. To leave Tai Long Wan, take the red minibus or walk 20 minutes south to take NWFB Route. 9 back to Shau Kei Wan MTR Station.

Gorgeous Views & a Pleasant Hike. I've done this hike several times with visitors to Hong Kong. They always appreciate getting out of the city and relaxing nature of this hike. I even did this hike with my 4 and 6 year old. From Shau Kei Wan take the #9 bus to the cemetery. If you start from this side you walk through covered forest first then end up hiking the gorgeous hills to see the peninsula. Once your finish you can head to the beach by taking the bus to Shek-O or cross the street and grab a taxi to Stanley Market to enjoy the village.If you're fast this can take you 1 hour. If you are with young children or taking it easy this can take you up to 3 hours. It's a short hike but beautiful way to see HK!

dragon style of hike. 1 of the best places in hong kong specially for hikers & even while you are inside cable car ,you wil see the real beauty of nature there & hikers hike with mind captivating views . you must visit it .

beautiful and refresh. When we feel tired of work. Come on vacation and enjoy this beautiful view and the silent of nature. No noise sound. Very peacefull and silent. We can see this track from cable car. Looks like dragon's back

้้Dragon's Back Trail. This is a very beautiful place in HK, name Dragon's back trail. The trail take 2-3 hrs walk(about 8 km.)- How to get there, 1.You can take MRT to Sheu Kei Wan station, exit A.2.Take the bus No.9 (located in front of exit A)3.Stop at To Tai wan bus stop.4.You reached at the beginning point.- you need to prepare a bottle of water, food, sun glasses, sun box, etc. and also a good shoes. - don't miss the big wave beach and shek o beach have fun

Beautiful hike. Defenitely worth the trip! It's so nice go get out of the city for a few hours and see the beautiful landscape of Hong Kong. The hike ends on a beach where we stayed a few hours and had lunch. We took the local bus to the hike's starting point which wasn't too hard. Back from the beach you can take a public car for a reasonable price. The hike defenitely didn't take us three hours but you want to put at least half a day aside for this.
Great Hike with Stunning Views. I have lived in HK for 20 years and only did this for the first time Friday! The views are fabulous and the hike was perfect. Not super easy nor very strenuous!

Great views, nice trail for beginners. Perfect for beginners. If you start in Chai Wan though be prepared to walk many, many stairs up!! But I prefer walking from Chai Wan to Shek O as the views only get better and you end in Shek O which is the perfect place to end up after a long hike!

Very nice hiking. Went during winter, the view were all fogged up, but very gd trail, suitable for kids & adults. We start the trail through some Chinese cemetery. Lots of steps to do, after that the trail pretty flat. Whole trail cemented.

Great hike. Went on Sunday with a friend, really easy to find, the hike is a little bit weird, lot of steps at the beginning. DO NOT GO ON A SUNDAY, way too crowded. Took about 3 hours to finish the hike, but we lost half the time taking pictures and trying to get ahead of people with little kids, or annoying people who walked to slowly. Beautiful view on the top.

Awesome Hike. Dragon's Back is one of the best hikes in Hong Kong and it's not too hard so almost anyone can walk it. It combines the best of nature trails with great views of south of Hong Kong Island from high above.Getting there: take a bus 9 from Shau Kei Wan MTR station (Island line) and alight after 20 min/11 stops at To Tei Wan. You will see an entrance to Dragon's Back right near the bus station. Use toilets there as another opportunity is almost an hour away.Walking the path: the route is relatively well marked and there are only 2-3 places where you need to make a decision where to turn. In total, the hike is about 8 km long and may take 2 hours or longer, depending on your pace.Difficulty: first 30-40 min (1.5-2 km) is an uphill climb to Shek O Peak which is relatively tough. Also, there is little shade at this section so be prepared. Shortly after reaching the peak and enjoying the views on the way, you get into a forest where a beautiful nature walk begins. It's quite shady there with water streams, butterflies flying around from time to time and birds chirping. Later on, there will be a paved section and them a forest walk again when you descend towards Big Wave Bay.After finishing the hike, you can catch a bus 9 or a red minibus shuttle to Chai Wan MTR station.Good luck and enjoy!

Beautiful & Easily Accessible. It's my third time in Hong Kong and it's the first time that I ventured out from the usual shopping and sightseeing activities. When I did my Googling, Dragon's Back came highly recommended. I decided to go for it as the trekkin is suitable for people with average fitness level, the place is easily accessible from MTR station and most importantly the place is astoundingly beautiful. I was happy that I made the right choice. The place meets my expectations. I started trekking at 8am and completed it at Big Wave Bay within 4 hours. Along the way I was mesmerised with beautiful sceneries that Dragon's Back is famous for and I took lots of pictures of floras and faunas. It was tiring but it was worth it. It's a different experience altogether.

Very nice (& easy) walk!. Walked this a couple of times during my week in HK. A very nice scenic walk. Only about 15mins taxi ride from Cental. The views are breath-taking. This is a very easy walk as it's along the top of the mountain. Highly recommended!

A great hike..... On 4 September we hiked Dragons Back. I was so glad I did my research before I left for Hong Kong and insisted that this be on our itinerary during our 7-day stay. It was amazing to say the least....flat at times and but also steep which left one breathless. We were moderately fit but beware - it can be taxing. The views along the way was something to behold. From views of the oceans and beautiful beaches to high rises peeking unexpectedly between mountains to the exquisite Big Wave beach at the end. Wear good walking shoes, sunhat, sunscreen and of course your camera because there is lots to see.

Great way to explore the nature side of HK. Highly recommended if you want to see the nature side of HK. This hike isn't for anyone (especially during the hot season) and you need to make sure that you take enough water with you.However, if you did manage to go on that hike it will be unforgettable

Nice views. Nice easy walk once I found the place. I read that you could get to it by going to chai wan MTR and walking up ( possible, if you have 2 hours). I took a taxi for $60 HK to start of trail and no 9 bus back down to shau kei wan to catch MTR back to central.Quite busy as I went on a bank holiday. Pretty location, but spoilt by people walking around with radios blasting out pop music!
A must see while in Hong Kong. While in Hong Kong take a tour of the City and go to see the Dragons Back great scenery from up at this level Take lots of photos

Dragon Never Went Away. Great hiking trail with breathtaking views of the South China Sea and all points in-between. A geomancer was employed to assist in the trails’ development. A Dragon’s breath must be able to flow freely, unimpeded. If the trail overlooked the wrong thing, or had indifferent fung shui, then it is out of luck, bad fortune. A geomancer mitigates the bad effects. This trail sits on the tip of a dragon’s tail. Chinese dragons sleep in the body of mountains, large hills, and it is exceedingly bad fung shui to disturb a dragon by building on top of one - at least, that is, until a geomancer has persuaded it to sleep elsewhere, as can be done because Chinese dragons are benevolent if shown respect and proper regard. Nevertheless, it is fine fung shui to build close to a dragon: overlooking the harbour water, and then the Gau Lung Mountains which contain no less than nine dragons.

A good hike offering stunning views . This is not a difficult hike and in fact very doable for an averagely fit person. Slightly under 10km, the trail took us about 2.5hrs-3hrs to complete at a leisurely pace. Along the way the views of the dragons back of course is the highlight but also just as mesmerizing is the beauty of the hill as we ascended and the pleasure of panoramic skyline. Many hikers along the way and people did not hesitate to say good morning or hello each time we passed so this definitely made the experience even more pleasant.
HK from an outdoor perspective. beautiful views on Sheko and big wave bay, it is not a difficult hike and everyone can enjoy it. A perfect way to easily discover the other side of HK

Great outing . 2 hrs of fun hike with amazing views. Lots of different walk trails. Foresty, small creeks, ridge walks with amazing views!If you go in late afternoon you can catch the paragliders taking off to fly over the golf course and land the dog beach next to Shek O. We saw a couple of beautiful small snakes. Just let them pass and you'll be fine. Definitely a must do in HK.

Easy hike with pleasant scenery. Dragon's Back always remains a nice warm-up hike for our weekend warriors before the hiking season kicks into full gear. This urban trail lies in the southeastern part of Hong Kong Island and is easily accessible by public transport. It is a scenic route around roughly 8km without skyscrapers blocking the view on the ridge, making it a perfect trail for novice hiker.

Hard work but so worth it. I was anxious about this walk as I'm a middle-aged and over weight mum/grandma but I managed it in 3 hours 20 minutes. The high temperature and humidity meant we took lots of water and drank the lot. I was absolutely soaked to the skin at the end but the many amazing views made it so worth it. The path was rough underfoot in parts with the middle section being easy walking. The beginning was quite steep and the end section very rough with no steps or rope to help on the descent. The walk ends at Big wave Beach were we had a wonderful swim. There's a changing room, toilets and shower block at the beach.

Nature Amidst modernity. Easy to get to via MTR to Shau Kei Wan and Bus 9 from Shau Kei Wan bus terminal which is located just outside the MTR station. Affording great views of Hong Kong other than the city skyline with a nice cool breeze at the top, a good place to explore other than the hustle and bustle of the city.
it was fun, fantastic view but please be careful... Hiked up the hill and thoroughly enjoyed the view and whole thing with nature. But please be careful if you have a fear of heights!

Wear your hiking shoes!. We hiked the Dragon's Back after reading amazing reviews. It didn't disappoint, the views were breathtaking, however it was a lot longer than the 6kms I believed it to be. I'd recommend this hike to anyone, but make sure you take plenty of food and water, and make sure that you're up for a challenge.

Very good view and easy walk. Dragon back is a very nice trail for a easy walk with a great ocean view. It is mostly flat and not much up and down hill, should be a very relaxed walk. On Sunday, it is super super busy. Local people walk there with kids and it could be quite noisy but it is a good walk anyway.

great views. well marked, great views. Just note there isn't much shade so on a hot day...Easy to get to- the guide on the discover hong kong website says it takes 6 hours - only if you stop and have a 3 hour picnic!

A must do experience!. A wonderful way to experience the beauty that Hong Kong has to offer. The directions are easy, the views fantastic, and the hike well worth the effort. There are times that you question what direction to proceed but with little effort that was quickly resolved. The end of the trail was quite pleasurable as we were greeted by a gorgeous beach and a tasty Hong Kong beer. The only negative to the entire experience where the 'toilets' that were poorly managed in all ways.

Amazing views!. I had a free day and decided to venture out to hike Dragon's Back trail. The trail that leads to the Dragon's Back trail starts right at a bus stop (bus #9 from the Shau Kei Station). This is a moderately strenuous hike up and down steep grades. The views are spectacular. A peaceful escape from the crowded bustling city and only 15 minutes bus ride away. Wear good hiking shoes and pack plenty of fluids on a hot day.
Excellent short (2 hr) hike. Great hike. Not sure why some of the websites say it takes 6 hours. It is 1.5- 2 hours hike unless you decide to go back.

Amazing, fantastic scenery, breathtaking views. You won't regret doing this walk. Dragon's back was recommended by friends and it did not disappoint. We took the MTR to Shau Kei Wan and then the number 9 bus to get to the start point (ask the driver to point it out). From the start I knew I was going to love it. Less then 1km in, you reach a viewpoint that is outstanding, from here you walk along the "Dragon's back" ridge, it was stunning. The walk is uneven terrain over rocks etc and could be challenging for the inexperienced. I walk fast but stopped for pictures along the way and it still took less than 3 hours. At the end is a very rewarding beach café where you can stop for a coconut and lookout to sea before taking a minibus back to Shau Kei Wan. This was the highlight of my visit to Hong Kong, if I ever go back I shall be doing this again p.s. take lots of water
A must hike. Great and challenging hike. Bring water and lunch 3-5 hours pending your pace take in all the beauty for sure a highlight and a getaway
Nice hike on the island. Good outdoor workout not far from downtown. And the reward... ariving at a beautiful beach! Bring water with you!

Nice walk way, great view.. It was my perfect trip walk up there until the end about 6 kilometers. Very nice view up on the hill. Easy to walk just keep looking for the sign. You will see some waterfall inside the forest. After find the road, catch a bus and go to the beach.

A nice Sunday Walk. A relatively easy hike on the south side of HK Island. The views are great with a majority of it unobstructed. The reward is at the end where you can finish up in Big Wave Bay and kick back a few beers to reward yourself.

Dragon's Back Trek. We completed this trek on 28 APR.Dragon’s Back’ refers to the path rolling along the ridges from Shek O Peak to Wan Cham Shan.We travelled to the starting point by bus. The End Point of our trek was "Tai Long Wan", also named "Big Wave Beach Bay".Waves reach several meters high in all seasons in the unobstructed bay, making it a surfer haunt.When arriving at "Tai Long Wan", we had lunch "Chez Wing", one of the two small restaurants which also serve beer/drinks.

Great half day hike. The hike is relatively easy, about 8km, taking 2.5 to 3 hours to complete. The starting point is the more challenging part, i.e. climbing many steps up the hill. Once at the top (i.e. the dragon’s back), the sea view is beautiful. However, there is no shade along the dragon’s back trail. Hence it can be very hot. Strongly advised to apply sun tan lotion or wear a sun hat. I saw many locals carrying umbrellas along this stretch. The end point, Big Wave Bay, is a nice and quiet beach. Getting there is quite straight forward. From Shau Kei Wan Station, exit at A3. Take bus 9 from Shau Kei Wan bus terminus to To Tei Wan on Shek O Road. The entrance to the hike is next to the bus stop at Shek O Road near To Tei Wan village.

Green then Blue.. Get you trainers and walk the trail. You will be greeted with lush greenery followed with a fresh view of the sea. The great outdoor just a stone throw way from the city. Avoid the weekends as you may need to queue for the bus.

Amazing urban hike in HK. This is one of my favourite urban hikes in Hong Kong, and it is also rated as one of the best hikes in Asia. I have led hiking tours several times on this trail, and each time I have enjoyed the scenery, the wilderness and the sense of adventure that you get through this trail. Most of the trail is in the Shek-O country park, and you have phenomenal views at the peaks of this trail. The trail winds down at Big wave bay, and allows you to soak in the sand and sea, which is always pleasant. Highly recommend you to try this trail if you live in HK or if you are visiting. It takes about 2/2.5 hours to complete.

Plenty of water!!. Just completed this Trail,for the 2nd time. Wasn't sure where the Taxi had dropped us,but soon realised,it was close to where we had STARTED last time a beautiful and scenic track,with some tough inclines and declines,and approx. 2hours duration,it is an absolute pleasure. And if you aim to finish at Big Wave Bay,a more than welcome cool off in the sea, is the icing on the cake

Half an island away but half a world away. A very convenient hike - the number 9 bus from Shau Kei Wan goes to both ends of the trail. If starting in the west, be ready for the right bus stop - it's called To Tei Wan and is right next to the start of the trail.The hike isn't very difficult apart from the heat and humidity. The first part up to and across Dragon's Back is spectacular - I saw Shek O shrouded in mist but on a clear day you would look out to sea. Then you go through dense forests for a long way until reaching Big Wave Bay (with a beach, bars and restaurants). I found a trail marked on the map that seemed to offer a much shorter path to the end but a few metres in was a giant spider web, complete with a giant spider, so I turned back. If you want a jungle experience, you could give it a go.
Great walk!. Great walk, great view - get out of the building and into the other Hong Kong up in this beautiful forest walk
Good exercise, great view. Great view but climb was not easy. Due to recent rain, ground was a bit slippery. Proper shoes are advised. Easy to get public transport.

Best stroll on HK Island. Great views and not too strenuous. You have two options. Option 1 is to start at the far end and walk back along the ridge (Dragon's Back) before heading down to Big Wave Bay to finish with a dip in the sea and a beer on the beach (highly recommended), this takes about 1.5-2 hours. Option 2 is to get off near the roundabout where the shek o road takes off (stop by the entrance to the correctional facility) and walk up and along dragons back, shorter and easier and takes about 1-1.5 hours. Both have the amazing views of Dragon's Back. I have done it with small kids who can also manage as there is little uphill.

great views on top with nice trail and fairly simple hike. a good hike that is steep at the beginning - first 20 min or so) then you are on the top (the dragon's back) and you get nice views over the ocean towards the souths and east. not too difficult and fairly easy to reach (Shau Kei Wan MTR - then Citybus 9 - get off after the roundabout and go up the hill to your left). at the end you can again board bus 9 to either Shek-O (have some food and beach and beer there!!) or back to Shau Kei Wan. green mini busses are also possible. if the winds are good then you will also see paragliders starting from the trail on the top! ;)

Fresh air and super views. Lovely walk. Not too challenging, a number of steps at the beginning but you can take those as slowly as you need. Can be busy at weekends, but this doesn't cause too many problems, just a few jams on the climb at the start. Great views and Big Wave Bay at the end is lovely. There are a few small cafes and shops at the beach too.

Must do hiking trip in HK. Easy to get to. MTR ride followed by a bus ride to get to the start point. Path is clearly marked so you won't get lost. Nice view from the top of the hill. Our hiking ended at the beach, nice finish with a swim.
Amazing view. Nothing will matter once you reached the top and overlook the amazing view this hike has to offer!!!
Dragon visible.. Wonderful view, the breezy air very fresh. Go with binoculars for unrushed views. See boats and ships.

Rewarding views along the path and not difficult. When you ascend to the hill top, you will have a gorgeous view over Shek O, a peninsular extending to the sea. Walk further to Tai Long Wan and ascend to the hill next to the beach. Beautiful! Go further to Shek O for the evening scenes.Take bus no. 9 from Shau Kei Wan Bus Terminus and get off at To Tei Wan, Shek O Road. Cross the street. You will see the signage of Dragon's Back. Distance is 8.5km up to Tai Long Wan. http://hkindependent-traveller-croatia.blogspot.hk/2015/03/from-dragons-back-to-tai-long-wan-and.html

Amazingly scenic, short (but humid) hike. A short train and local bus ride out of the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong city is this beautiful mountain ridge with glorious views over many uninhabited and heavily habited areas within Hong Kong. The hike is approximately 7-8km from To Tei Wan village (getting off the #9 bus before Shek O at the village) up to the great views at the top... & then down to Big Wave Bay at the bottom where you can have a well earned swim, &/or bite to eat and drink.It isn't the longest hike ever, but beware that it is quite likely to be hot and humid, and the uphill section at the beginning can be quite tiring... so take plenty of water and suitable footwear.

Wonderful walk, do it!. Take plenty of water and wear a hat if it's a hot day. This is a wonderful walk, steep in parts but amazing views, beautiful countryside and worth it. Take towel and bathers, Big Wave Bay lived up to its name on the day we were there and there is also beach at Shek O.

Views are worth the effort. Not as difficult as I had been led to believe, but still no pushover.Hard to reconcile the fact that there is a frantic busy city not that far away.Views are spectacular if you get a clearish day

Beautiful views!. I'm definitely not a hiker, but my friends who have been here before told me it wasn't too difficult. I read online that the whole thing should take around 6 hours (!) but it took us around 2.5, walking slowly and stopping a few times. The hike itself wasn't so difficult, what made it really hard was the weather. It was a hot day, middle of August and the air was so humid that it was extremely difficult to breathe at times. The first half was a climb up which has great views on the way as well. Then you get to the dragon's back (you'll see a sign saying you're there) and it's a great panoramic view. After that it gets less interesting, going back down through a forest, but there are some small waterfalls that are nice and the trail is much easier going down. I would definitely recommend doing this, but take lots (and lots) of water, some snacks, an umbrella for shade (there is almost no shade the whole half part) and a towel to wipe yourself off!

Breathtaking experience!. Wow! I'm glad I went here to experience this. It's located a bit outside of the main city, I took a bus. It has an amazing view over the sea and city and nearby villages. You walk a path along the top of a mountain and I advise to just stop regularly to just admire the view. It will take a long time so take with you a bottle of water or two and maybe some fruit or other snack. I got a bit confused by the end, I didn't know where to go when the Dragon's Back ended so I followed a path along the mountain for maybe 20 minutes and didn't know where I would end up. I kept on walking and eventually reached a road with signs and I went toward Big Wave beach and it took me 20-30 minutes to reach. From there is a bus back to the main city.
A bit far but great hike. You can take bus there at the trail head and the view was fantastic! Bring a towel if you like to cool off after the hike as the beach is clean and water is clean

Amazing views from the top!. The Dragon's Back is one of the best walks in Hong Kong, offering panoramic views once you reach the top. It is not an easy walk but exhilarating! Recommend to every visitor who likes hiking when they visit Hong Kong!

Enjoyable hike with beautiful views; great for beginners!. I will begin by admitting that I am not a hiker. My first attempt to hike Dragon's back was foiled by the rain, but I did return! Hearing that this hike was easy by my friends, I journeyed the whole time in flip flops alongside my best friend! Of course the hike was hot, but it was easy as well and we enjoyed talking during the whole hike. The views were spectacular and it was easy enough to find the starting location. My friend and I got turned around and couldn't find the path to the beach but we still had an excellent time. This is a great beginner hike or hike for a tourist who wants to see some beautiful natural views during their time in Hong Kong

Top of the World perspectives from a Hill. Just a short MTR and bus ride away from WanChai where we stayed was the trekking route up to the famed Dragon's Back in HK on HK island itself. as the bus left the city and climbed through the verdant lush forests, the scenery changed from one of crowded urbanscape to a refreshing vista of greenery and glimpses of the sea! the trek entrance from Shek O road was clearly marked and the easy route took just minutes to break out of the forest cover to the bare hill trail as we ascended onto the Dragon's Back itself. Its an easy climb by all accounts and totally worth it for an experience in HK that is for nature lovers and for the incredible views. We did the whole trail and finished down at BIG WAVE bay some 3 hours later to refresh ourselves in the cool waters as the surf rolled in. An altogether rustic morning side tour that was a beneficial for the soul as it was to work off some calories from the gastronomical offerings of HK!

Beautiful Hike. This was such an awesome walk with beautiful scenery. On the day we went it was slightly wet and at times very windy. This didn't stop us from enjoying this beautiful piece of HK and if I had not walked this, I would not have thought HK had such a beautiful coastline. If you have the time and want to do some hiking, definitely consider this one.I can imagine it being even more fantastic on a super sunny day. Depending on which part of HK you are staying in, you can get to the starting point by bus but easier if you just hopped into a cab and share the cost with your travel companion.

Probably the No. 1 choice if you want to see the green side of Hong Kong. I was there a few times already in different seasons of the year. It is always enjoyable. The track is easy to access and one could finish it within say half a day or even less. So it is good even for local who are tight in their time schedule. The views are great and rewarding. The trail isn't too bad even for children to climb. Another great reward is to take either lunch or dinner at Shek O at the end of the ride.

Strenuous 2 hour hike. We had a spare afternoon and wanted to go hiking and so tried the Dragon's Back. It's a well signposted walk of about 4-5km and takes a couple of hours. It isn't flat and has a large amount of steps. We went after it had rained and it was quite muddy and slippery, however it's very well maintained and we thoroughly enjoyed our day.It seems to be signposted for mountain biking too - however I wouldn't bother unless you are very very hardened and like a challenge!

Rewarding views. Great day trip with rewarding views of HK's stunning scenery. This is medium difficulty. The first half is lot of climbing then it gets better. Carry water and energy bars. We saw some people para gliding. That was lovely.
